results.question: List all available sectors in the GFS data
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT sector_name FROM sectors ORDER BY sector_name
results.predicted_sql: SELECT DISTINCT sector_name FROM sectors ORDER BY sector_name

results.question: How many GEM observations are in the database?
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS observation_count FROM gem_observations
results.predicted_sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM gem_observations

results.question: What is the latest year in the GEM observations?
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT MAX(year) AS latest_year FROM gem_observations
results.predicted_sql: SELECT MAX(year) AS latest_year FROM gem_observations

results.question: List countries whose names start with 'A'
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT country_name FROM countries WHERE country_name LIKE 'A%' ORDER BY country_name
results.predicted_sql: SELECT country_name FROM countries WHERE country_name LIKE 'A%';

results.question: What is the earliest year in the GFS observations?
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT MIN(year) AS earliest_year FROM gfs_observations
results.predicted_sql: SELECT MIN(year) AS earliest_year FROM gfs_observations

results.question: How many observations have 'Percent of GDP' as the transformation?
results.ground_truth_sql: SELECT COUNT(*) AS count FROM gfs_observations WHERE transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
results.predicted_sql: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM observations WHERE transformation = 'Percent of GDP';

results.question: Show government revenue (percent of GDP) for Australia from 2010 to 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS revenue_pct_gdp
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Revenue, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.value FROM gfs_observations g JOIN time_periods t ON g.year = t.year JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.id WHERE g.sector_id = 1 AND g.indicator_id = 15 AND g.frequency = 4 AND g.unit = 'Percent of GDP' AND c.name = 'Australia' AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020

results.question: Show the stock market index for the United Kingdom from 2015 to 2023
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS stock_market
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'United Kingdom'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Stock Markets'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2023
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.year, g.value AS stock_market_index FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id WHERE c.country = 'United Kingdom' AND g.indicator_id = 1 AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2023 ORDER BY g.year

results.question: Show GDP at market prices for the United States for all available years
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS gdp_millions
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'United States'
AND i.indicator_name = 'GDP at market prices'
AND i.unit = 'constant 2010 US$, millions'
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT DISTINCT g.year, g.value AS gdp_millions FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id WHERE c.country_name = 'United States' AND g.indicator_id = 1 AND g.year BETWEEN 1990 AND 2020 ORDER BY g.year

results.question: Show terms of trade for Australia from 2010 to 2023
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS terms_of_trade
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Terms of Trade'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2023
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.year, g.value AS terms_of_trade_australia FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id WHERE c.country_name = 'Australia' AND g.transformation = 'Current price' AND g.scale = 'Market prices' AND g.frequency = 'Annual' AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2023 ORDER BY g.year

results.question: Find country-years with high unemployment rate (>10%) from GEM data between 2010 and 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT
    c.country_name,
    g.year,
    g.value AS unemployment_rate
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE i.indicator_name = 'Unemployment Rate'
    AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020
    AND g.value > 10
ORDER BY g.value DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT c.country_name, g.year FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id JOIN time_periods t ON g.year = t.year WHERE g.value > 10 AND g.year BETWEEN 2010 AND 2020 ORDER BY g.value DESC

results.question: List the top 5 countries by number of GEM observations
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT c.country_name, COUNT(*) AS obs_count
FROM gem_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
GROUP BY c.country_name
ORDER BY obs_count DESC
LIMIT 5
results.predicted_sql: SELECT c.country_name, COUNT(*) AS obs_count FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id GROUP BY c.country_name ORDER BY obs_count DESC LIMIT 5

results.question: Show government social benefits (percent of GDP) for Germany from 2000 to 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year, g.value AS social_benefits_pct_gdp
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Germany'
AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Social benefits, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2000 AND 2020
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.year, g.value AS social_benefits_pct_gdp FROM gem_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id WHERE c.country_name = 'Germany' AND g.indicator_id = 11 AND g.year BETWEEN 2000 AND 2020 ORDER BY g.year

results.question: Count the number of countries with GEM data for each year
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT year, COUNT(DISTINCT country_id) AS country_count
FROM gem_observations
GROUP BY year
ORDER BY year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT year, COUNT(DISTINCT country_id) AS country_count FROM gem_observations GROUP BY year ORDER BY country_count DESC

results.question: What is the sum of all GFS observation values for the year 2020?
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT SUM(value) AS total_value
FROM gfs_observations
WHERE year = 2020
results.predicted_sql: SELECT SUM(T1.value) FROM gfs_observations AS T1 JOIN time_periods AS T2 ON T1.year = T2.year WHERE T1.year = 2020

results.question: List all countries with tax revenue data for 2020
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT DISTINCT c.country_name
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.year = 2020
ORDER BY c.country_name
results.predicted_sql: SELECT c.country_name FROM countries c JOIN country_tax_revenue ct ON c.country_id = ct.country_id JOIN tax_revenue tr ON ct.tax_revenue_id = tr.tax_revenue_id WHERE tr.year = 2020;

results.question: What is the average value by sector for GFS observations in 2020?
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT s.sector_name, AVG(g.value) AS avg_value
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
WHERE g.year = 2020
GROUP BY s.sector_name
ORDER BY avg_value DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT s.sector_name, AVG(g.value) AS avg_gfs_value FROM gfs_observations g JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id WHERE g.year = 2020 GROUP BY s.sector_name ORDER BY avg_gfs_value DESC

results.question: Find the top 5 countries by combined GFS and GEM data availability (total observations)
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH combined AS (
    SELECT country_id, 'GFS' AS source FROM gfs_observations
    UNION ALL
    SELECT country_id, 'GEM' AS source FROM gem_observations
)
SELECT c.country_name, 
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GFS' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gfs_obs,
       SUM(CASE WHEN source = 'GEM' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS gem_obs,
       COUNT(*) AS total_obs
FROM combined
JOIN countries c ON combined.country_id = c.country_id
GROUP BY c.country_name
ORDER BY total_obs DESC
LIMIT 5
results.predicted_sql: SELECT c.country_name, COUNT(g.year) AS gem_count, COUNT(g2.year) AS gfs_count, COUNT(g.year) + COUNT(g2.year) AS total_count FROM countries c JOIN gem_observations g ON c.country_id = g.country_id JOIN gfs_observations g2 ON c.country_id = g2.country_id WHERE g.year = 2020 AND g2.year = 2020 GROUP BY c.country_name ORDER BY total_count DESC LIMIT 5

results.question: Calculate the correlation between government revenue and expenditure across all countries for 2019
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH paired_data AS (
    SELECT c.country_name,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS revenue,
           SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS expenditure
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE s.sector_name = 'General government'
    AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
    AND g.year = 2019
    GROUP BY c.country_name
    HAVING SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Revenue%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
       AND SUM(CASE WHEN i.indicator_name LIKE '%Expenditure%' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) > 0
),
stats AS (
    SELECT 
        COUNT(*) AS n,
        SUM(revenue) AS sum_x,
        SUM(expenditure) AS sum_y,
        SUM(revenue * expenditure) AS sum_xy,
        SUM(revenue * revenue) AS sum_xx,
        SUM(expenditure * expenditure) AS sum_yy
    FROM paired_data
)
SELECT 
    n AS sample_size,
    (n * sum_xy - sum_x * sum_y) / 
    SQRT((n * sum_xx - sum_x * sum_x) * (n * sum_yy - sum_y * sum_y)) AS correlation
FROM stats
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.value AS revenue, e.value AS expenditure FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id WHERE g.year = 2019 AND g.sector_id = 1 AND c.country_name IN ('Australia', 'Canada', 'France', 'Germany', 'India', 'Italy', 'Japan', 'Mexico', 'Russia', 'South Africa', 'South Korea', 'Sweden', 'Switzerland', 'Turkey', 'United Kingdom', 'United States') ORDER BY g.value

results.question: Compare tax revenues as a percentage of GDP across countries with good data coverage (Singapore, Australia, Israel, South Africa, Chile) for 2020, ranking them from highest to lowest
results.ground_truth_sql:
WITH Tax_Revenue AS (
    SELECT 
        c.country_name,
        g.value AS tax_revenue_pct_gdp
    FROM gfs_observations g
    JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
    JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
    JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
    WHERE c.country_name IN ('Singapore', 'Australia', 'Israel', 'South Africa', 'Chile')
        AND g.year = 2020
        AND s.sector_name = 'General government'
        AND i.indicator_name = 'Taxes, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
        AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
),
Avg_Tax AS (
    SELECT AVG(tax_revenue_pct_gdp) AS avg_tax_revenue
    FROM Tax_Revenue
)
SELECT 
    t.country_name,
    t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp,
    a.avg_tax_revenue AS group_average,
    (t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp - a.avg_tax_revenue) AS difference_from_avg
FROM Tax_Revenue t
CROSS JOIN Avg_Tax a
ORDER BY t.tax_revenue_pct_gdp DESC
results.predicted_sql: SELECT c.country_name, g.value AS tax_revenue_pct_gdp FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id WHERE g.year = 2020 AND c.country_name IN ('Singapore', 'Australia', 'Israel', 'South Africa', 'Chile') AND s.sector_name = 'Taxes' ORDER BY g.value DESC

results.question: Compare government expenditure between central and local government for Brazil over 2015-2022
results.ground_truth_sql:
SELECT g.year,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS central_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS local_govt,
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Central government including social security' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) -
       SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_name = 'Local Government' THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS difference
FROM gfs_observations g
JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id
JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id
JOIN indicators i ON g.indicator_id = i.indicator_id
WHERE c.country_name = 'Brazil'
AND i.indicator_name = 'Expenditure, Transactions (cash basis of recording), Cash basis'
AND g.transformation = 'Percent of GDP'
AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2022
GROUP BY g.year
ORDER BY g.year
results.predicted_sql: SELECT g.year, SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_id = 1 THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS central_govt, SUM(CASE WHEN s.sector_id = 2 THEN g.value ELSE 0 END) AS local_govt, SUM(g.value) AS total_govt FROM gfs_observations g JOIN countries c ON g.country_id = c.country_id JOIN sectors s ON g.sector_id = s.sector_id JOIN years y ON g.year = y.year WHERE c.country_name = 'Brazil' AND g.year BETWEEN 2015 AND 2022 GROUP BY g.year ORDER BY g.year
